pros: Small company feel, great management support.  Patient-focused.
cons: EMR, Remote workers can feel disconnected.

job_title: Medical Social Worker in Cleveland, OH
pros: Providing in-home support and education to the patients. Relatively nice database in the tablet for documentation. IT helps on the spot.
cons: Rude behavior from the president, administrators and HR who offer NO support unless you are in their "click", total disrespect for the SW profession, very long hours of which there is no compensation. Everything seemed very nice until new management took over, folks left or were fired and replaced by...ever hear of nepotism? Morale fell and is continuing to fall very quickly...never worked for a (dis-)organization like this before.

pros: Flexible work schedule, great middle managers
cons: Weekend work requirements and holidays

review_title: A truly sad state of affairs
pros: Very mission driven and truly believe in patient care and helping those that other organizations may not care for.
cons: This was one of the most dysfunctional places I have ever worked.  I cannot imagine their doors being open much longer.  Under the previous CEO it declined, year after year and the board turned a blind eye to the needs of the organization and its sustainability.  The people she put in place were and are unqualified, lack leadership, manners and would not survive or have the title and pay they do at any other organization in Northeast Ohio.  Highly lacking in professionalism, accountability, and appropriate business behavior. This place has so many new ideas and was changed so many times in structure, layoffs, reorgs, whatever she called in that month that it was erratic, manic and out of control.  I think this place,  while once a leader in the field in its day, was long left behind when leadership changed hands, which was needed, but has been damaged beyond repair.  The mood, despair and distrust was like nothing I have ever seen and prevails. Sadly, this ship cannot be righted as it has been rammed onto dry land over the last eight years repeatedly and has been in distress since then.  So sad because there is a mission, just leadership is and was lacking for too long to sustain it or grow it.  What a shame.

pros: There are no longer any pros to this company
cons: Expected unpaid overtime daily. Unrealistic productivity expectations.  Focus is quantity that you can see daily not quality care giving. Unable to get approved for any paid time off. Micromanagement. Upper management is malicious.  The documentation  program is impossible! Takes forever to document on each visit. Especially admission visits.

job_title: Certified Home Health Aide in Cleveland, OH
pros: flexible work but need more work
cons: not enough work with them

job_title: RN Case Manager in Cleveland, OH
pros: Very hardworking clinicians that really care about the patient - and each other. The ground level employees put their patients first and live the mission.
cons:
There is no leadership at the executive level !  They are all too busy trying to advance themselves rather than lead their clinicians and support them in being successful. They are disengaged and use team meetings as a substitute for communication.  There is never follow up to these team meetings and this results in leaving the field staff disconnected and floundering.  

The loss of valuable, long-term, and invested employees is sadly profound. The resignation of the CEO was a start in moving toward improvement, but the current leadership is just an extension of the existing problems that have plagued VNA.  The executive leadership team is good at delegating, but not at leading!  Their investment lies in their own advancement rather than the good of the organization as a whole. 

Lastly, there is no vote of confidence in the Board that has allowed VNA to go mismanaged for years. Sadly, they have  failed to hold anyone accountable.  How can they not question the deluge of resignations?  "People leave managers not companies...in the end, turnover is mostly a manager issue.

pros: Dedicated field staff, committed to providing excellent care despite the working conditions
cons:
The downside to to working at this company is that no matter how much you care, or how well you do your job, the push from management will always be for more--more of your time, more of your energy, more of your skill, at the risk of your health, your safety, and your salary/wage. 

Management structure could be compared to the game "Guess Who" or, perhaps, a circus. 

Pay scale for field workers is laughable--especially the Aides.

pros: Great base of intelligent employees with big hearts and a great work ethic.
cons: Top upper management has created a toxic culture of distrust, secrecy, and retribution.  The "Leadership" and their chosen minions are in a continual struggle between advancing their own personal agendas and stepping on each other to get ahead.  This has helped create a huge disconnect from the rest of the employees, leaving them with feelings of resentment, disengagement and vulnerability.  Inflated egos with big titles driving a 100+year old organization into the ground.

review_title: Save yourself the headache and disappointment
job_title: RN Case Manager in Cleveland, OH
pros: Some co-workers are great and made some friends, decent pay scale, okay benefits.
cons: Poor management, Union has gone downhill, company reputation has dropped tremendously over the years and other employers look poorly on seeing work history with this company. There has been a lot of turn over, restructuring, being bought out, then taking over a failing company. Many patients have suffered in all the turmoil and several were discharged or left without care for extended periods.  Territories are not recognized and you will have to travel to several counties on the same day.  They micro manage and you will be doing a lot of charting on your own time. There are plenty other options out there...choose one of them! Actively looking!

pros: The people who work here that give their heart and soul to the job - the home care workers - the hospice workers - rehab - mental health.....THESE people are priceless.
cons: Where to begin?? Let's start with the President who spent more time studying for her PhD than actually running the organization.  In the years that she's been at the helm, the organization has gone steadily and rapidly downhill, resulting in financial troubles and extremely low morale.  The "team" that she has assembled spends most of their time cat fighting and clawing at each other to get to the top.  Many of the worker bees (and I use the term "worker" very loosely) leave much to be desired.  Granted, there is a lot that is expected of the employees of the VNA, but if an employee gets to the point where he or she can't be civil and pleasant despite the stresses of the job, it's time to move on.  Upper "management" is completely disconnected.  They are under the false impression that the ENGAGE Committee is effective in keeping the employees engaged, when in reality, it is a colossal waste of time for all involved.  Like all organizations, there is a fair amount of office politics and favoritism that goes on here, but the President crosses the line by being too familiar/connected with certain employees.  I could go on and on about the lack of professionalism and inefficiencies of this organization, but you get the general idea.  The good work that is done by the employees who have the patients' best interests at heart is overshadowed by the conniving, lazy, and inappropriate behavior of the people chosen to lead the organization.  Sad, sad, sad.

pros: Good communication. Good action plans during times of trouble. Generally a great group of professionals who look out after each other and our communities. When I started they had a fabulous computer/ document classes. Town Hall Meetings every month were great for trouble shooting and getting to know all the disciplines...which improved moral and better yet patient outcomes!
cons: Cannot think of any cons or negative results

pros: Mission driven, history, and a genuine care and concern for patients and families. There is flexibility for some staff and if you are part of that group it is great. It will allow for work life balance. Good location and free parking.
cons: Doesn't  have resources to stay competitive, provide resources or  proper training for all staff. Behind the times in their thinking and in a state of flux or scrambling for a new plan constantly,  which lead to poor morale and big concerns for job security. Too many finger pointers and blamers at the top, out of touch with the market.

pros: Very nice and hard working co-workers in the trenches.
cons: Whole departments get ignored until they are in crisis.  Then it’s the “blame-game” as Administration looks to hang someone for something they are ultimately responsible for.  This scenario has been repeating itself for years now.   Somehow the same person keeps her high position despite this negative cycle.

job_title: Personal Care Assistance in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Weekly pay, paid travel ,paid time to come to office meetings, uniform tops provided ,supplies provided ie.  gloves, hand soap etc.
cons: wanting field staff to constantly come into the office, supervisor and administrator ,office nurse for orientation, were all terrible that's how I lost my job.My supervisor and orientation nurse harassed me over paperworksupervisor had bad attitude and talk to me very poorlythat is field supervisor. I've worked in home care a long time lost my job here in 3 weeks

job_title: Home Health Aide in Cleveland, OH
pros: Working independently, treated with respect, can be somewhat flexible
cons: Low pay, difficult to trade shifts without having any contact with staff,  have to deal with disrespectful and ungrateful people sometimes

job_title: RN Case Manager in Cleveland, OH
pros: Worked with the best, most tenured nurses in the business.
cons: Office politics, unprofessional at times, not enough nurses to take care of patients, lengthy paperwork.

pros: fair pay and great co-workers
cons: Uncertain vision and leadership was weak. Since then they seem to be rebuilding relationships with other organizations that should help.

pros: some flexibility in hours, compassionate caregivers
cons: high expectations on documentation load;

pros: Compassionate caregivers give exceptional care.
cons: Clinical leadership is mean-spirited, uncaring and clueless

job_title: RN Case Manager in Cleveland, OH
pros: The union protection (you need it there) and the pay.
cons: They force you to work in unsafe situations. Caseloads are too high and they expect you’ll work 12 hours and get paid 8. The management is vindictive out for their own benefit, not the patients.

pros: Great nurses who believe  in serving patients to the best of their abilities.
cons: Terrible leadership/management - a "mean girl" mentality starting at the very top working it's way down.

pros: Salary and working environment is fine.
cons: There are a lot of waste

review_title: Still here and getting better everyday!
pros: Great mission, focused professional staff.
cons: Growing competition in our area

pros: Nothing to write about.  Sad but true
cons: Everyone is on own me me me bus.  No loyalty. Very bad atmosphere.  They don't take out for city tax n neglect to say something about it.
